result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

2021CF000091, 2022CF000007, 2022CF000064, 2022CF000065, 2022CF000119
Attorney Burdick is heard on the status of the cases. Requests another status.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:33 AM Cases called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF91, 22CF07, 22CF64, 22CF65 & 22CF119 called together
Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone. 

22CF119 - Preliminary Hearing
Atty Burdick states def. is waiving preliminary - has reviewed plea questionnaire with defendant

Court questions def. re: waiver of preliminary hearing
Court finds waiver is freely knowingly and voluntarily made, accepts defendants waiver of preliminary hearing and finds probable cause

Atty Burkick states Defendant waives formal reading, stands mute
Clerk directed to enter NOT GUILTY pleas into the record for all counts

Atty Burdick states first four cases are resolved - would be ideal to keep all cases together. Do have an offer on newest case that he will discuss with def. 
Court will schedule all cases for status, if newest case is resolved can get a plea and sentencing date for all
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court - 22CF119 needs Preliminary hearing
Atty. Burdick is heard on status - has received offer on newest case, requests preliminary hearing on most recent case- then all cases can ride together

 Court advises def. that she has signed the conditional release for his forfeiture matters

2:13 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated:  Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Court approves Zoom.

1:50 PM Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant provides the court a waiver of right to an attorney. 
Court informs the Defendant the right to counsel. Court goes over the waiver with defendant. Defendant states understanding.
Defendant is freely, knowingly and voluntarily making the decision to represent himself.  
Court approves the defendant to represent himself.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court questions def. re: progress in retaining attorney.
Def. states he is willing to proceed with waiving his right to an attorney.
Court cannot go forward without the signed waiver form - will continue this matter for def. to complete waiver form
Hearing can be by zoom if waiver is filed prior to hearing.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.  Public defender information provided to defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:37 AM Case called to Order by Court.  Appearances:  Defendant Patrick Michael Tesar Sr appeared by video, in custody, Plaintiff Lukas Steiner DA appeared by video. 
     Court finds probable cause.  D.A. requests $150 cash; has posted in 21CF91 $150.00; not poss/cons. any controlled substances; testing by L.E.  
     Def. asks for a signature bond.  
     Court comments; orders $150.00 cash; not poss/cons any controlled substances; submit to random UAs by L.E.; if positive, submit to blood draw.  Initial Appearance on January 10, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.  Advised of right to an atty.  Defendant states understanding.
     Court concludes at 10:42 a.m.
Hearing scheduled for January 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
